resource.chars: Fauvel, who wants to throw himself in headfirst,
In order to show his arrogance,
Has it proclaimed throughout the area
That anyone who wishes, that day
Or the following four days,
To joust, should come without hesitating.
There will be no one, however violent,
Whether or not he is invited through an announcement,
Who is not received at the joust,
Which will take place the day after Pentecost,
And they who assemble for the joust
Will have his favor.
About these jousts and the assembly
Word has already spread everywhere,
So that ladies and maidens,
In hearing this extraordinary news,
And because the date approaches,
Feel impatient about them and are eager
To prepare for them and leave
In order to see the festivities and the joy.
And, in order to better preserve their reputations,
They do not wish to delay.
But, through a special exception,
Ladies of great morality,
Namely every single one of the divine Virtues
Who have been banished from
The domains and lands of Fauvel,
Will come to watch the festivities.
They are Virginity,
Who is of such dignity
That it is through her that God deigned
To shelter himself in the Virgin to deliver
Us from eternal suffering,
In a miraculous manner.
And she who gave birth as a virgin,
Virginity loves her dearly
That she will not go there without her
Even if she is not very welcome there.
Chastity and Religion,
Repentance and Confession,
Contrition and Penitence,
Compunction and Patience,
Humility and Simplicity,
Obedience and Prayer...
Then, without any doubt,
Sincerity, Alms and Conscience,
Temperance and Innocence,
Courtesy and Friendship
Kindness and Pity,
Perseverance and Charity,
Wisdom and Truth,
Providence and Mercy,
Justice, Loyalty, Concord,
Goodness, Joy, Faith, Silence
Forgiveness, Fear of God, Knowledge,
Moderation and good Generosity,
Fairness, Goodness and Prowess
And the other sisters, handmaidens of God,
Of which there are so many
That one would not be able to enumerate them.
They will come, without any missing,
Not for pleasure or entertainment,
But rather to see Fauvel, who, in a brief time
Will be horribly destroyed,
Unless the beautiful Reason lies,
And Fortune goes back
On her decision.
Nevertheless, if, randomly,
Fortune wishes and consents
That they have the gift of being able to joust,
They will joust in such a way
That they will receive a similar gift from God, who gives everything,
And who rewards all good actions.
Each one of them gives her consent.
Even Peace, Patience and Concord
Wish to come, to this place that belongs to them,
From which Fauvel, led by Antichrist,
Has chased them out without a reason.
They have sent, for it is the moment,
To the city described above
Which is called Hope,
Humility, who goes ahead to find lodging for them,
So that she can find a good inn.
Saint Julian, who came to meet her,
And generously hosted her,
And directed her to a good inn,
—The greatest in the valley—.
And through true chance,
He sent her to people who have always taken care
To love the aforementioned ladies,
And the ladies loved them as well
Without any trace of bitterness.
They will be received all the more generously there.
The host, whose inn was chosen
For the ladies of such worth,
As you know, had four names
If we pay attention to this:
Generous, Courtly, Wise and Kind,
And his wife, whose name was Lady Constance,
Was good and dignified.
She bears the banner
Of Loyalty and of Pity
Of Sweetness and of Friendship,
Of Honor, of Goodness and of Sense.
Now I will tell you what I think
About the great joy they felt
From the desired arrival
Of these ladies who take such pleasure
In doing good wherever they live.
The host, who knew their secret,
And knew that they loved him with true love,
Had in the nearby burgs and cities,
Wealthy relatives and sons and daughters,
As well as friends with great power.
He wrote to those to whom he was closest
And told them to come straight away,
Without being frightened or delaying.
They tell themselves that it is not appropriate
To test them, for the good man
Had complete command
Over each one of them and the whole group.
They begged him to tell them
What he wished, and without delay,
He will see his wish realized.
Then he tells them that, whatever it costs him,
They should acquire harnesses and big horses for the joust,
Good suits of armor and ornaments,
From the best that could be sought
And such that no one would be able to find similar ones,
And all this for thirty maidens,
In great affection.
They all proclaim with one cry:
“Sir, before it becomes a matter of necessity,
You will have everything that is fitting for this project
Without anything lacking!”
His heart flies and jumps because of this,
And he thanks them kindly.
After this they depart cheerily.
The ladies know with certitude
That the moment is arriving fast
To depart, for whoever wants
To make the trip, so they packed up
